item.title: Git, Dotfiles, and the Dream of a Truly Cross-Platform Work Environment
item.description: So last October I started using Git to track my dotfiles and config files. Although it makes sense to use version control in case you make a change that breaks your system, to me the biggest appeal of doing this was so that I could easily synchronize all my config files between devices. My first commit included config files for npm and vim, and now it’s grown to include bash, window managers, and terminal emulators.
